Class Platform

java.lang.Object
game.entities.Entity
game.entities.Platform
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collidable
public class Platform extends Entity
Represents a platform that the player can jump on and land. Platforms scroll from right to left and have theme-dependent visuals.

Features:

  • Supports three themes: MORNING, SUNSET, MIDNIGHT
  • Each platform uses random tile frames for visual variety
  • Static theme management affects all platform instances
  • Platforms spawn at various heights and widths

  • Constructor Details

    • Platform

      public Platform(double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Constructs a new Platform with specified dimensions. Automatically loads sprites and generates random tile frames.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate
      y - the y-coordinate
      width - the width of the platform
      height - the height of the platform

  • Method Details

    • generateRandomTiles

      private void generateRandomTiles()
      Generates random tile frame indices for visual variety. Each 48px tile segment gets a random frame (0-6).

    • loadSprite

      private void loadSprite()
      Loads platform sprite sheets and animations for all three themes. This is called once and shared across all platform instances.

    • setTheme

      public static void setTheme(String theme)
      Changes the visual theme for all Platform instances. This is a static method that affects the shared platform animations.
      Parameters:
      theme - the theme name ("MORNING", "SUNSET", or "MIDNIGHT")

    • update

      public void update(double dt)
      Description copied from class: Entity
      Updates the entity's state based on elapsed time. Must be implemented by subclasses to define specific behavior.
      Specified by:
      update in class Entity
      Parameters:
      dt - delta time in seconds since last update
